intro: Chorizanthe polygonoides, commonly known as desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent-like leaves. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It has a low-growing, sprawling habit and produces numerous small, pink to red flowers that bloom in the spring. The species is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a hardy plant in desert landscapes.
